borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p>The outbuilding would present a commercial use within a residential setting which is considered to be&nbsp; inappropriate, failing to be ancillary to the host dwelling and resulting in an increase in noise, distuburbance and odours for the neighbouring properties. As such, this is considered to be unacceptable and contrary to:</p><ul><li><span style="font-size:11pt">National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (MHCLG</span><span style="font-size:11pt">, December 2024)</span></li><li><span style="font-size:11pt">Policies D4 and D6 of the London Plan&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size:11pt">(March 2021)</span></li><li><span style="font-size:11pt">Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of the LBBD Local Plan</span><span style="font-size:11pt">&nbsp;(September 2024)</span></li><li><span style="font-size:11pt"><span style="font-size:11pt">Residential Extensions and Alterations (SPD) (February 2012)</span></span></li></ul>

<p>The&nbsp;proposal lacks clarity regarding both the scope and nature of the application, failing to explicitly indicate the commercial use of the outbuilding which&nbsp;in turn could have mislead and prejudiced third parties&nbsp;who may otherwise have wished to comment on the application; the proposed development cannot be accurately assessed and it cannot be demonstrated that it would be supported by the Development Plan.&nbsp;&nbsp;This is unacceptable and contrary to:</p><ul><li>National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (MHCLG, December 2024)</li><li>Policy SD6 and SD7 of the London Plan (March 2021)</li><li><span style="font-size: 14.6667px;">Policy DME 3 of the LBBD Local Plan (September 2024)</span></li></ul>
description:
Retrospective application for the demolition of
the pre- existing outbuilding and construction of a single storey rear
outbuilding
